member.summary: Extension class for allowing to comment currently running steps.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Commenting.StepExecutionExtensions.Comment(LightBDD.Framework.StepExecution,System.String)
member.summary:
Comments currently executed step with a text. The comment would be included in progress notification, as well as in execution reports.
This feature has to be enabled in via () prior to usage.
member.param: Comment to add. If comment is null or empty, it will not be added.

member.name: T:LightBDD.Framework.FeatureDescriptionAttribute
member.summary:
Feature description attribute that can be applied on feature test class. May be used to enrich feature class with description like "In order to... As a... I want to..." or similar, that would be used by progress notifier and would be included in summary.
If given implementation supports alternative description attributes, and both are applied on class, this one would be used.

member.name: T:LightBDD.Framework.IBddRunner`1
member.summary: The base runner interface describing runner that can execute scenarios within specified context. See also: .
member.typeparam: The context type that would be used in scenario execution.

member.name: T:LightBDD.Framework.IBddRunner
member.summary: Main LightBDD runner interface that should be used in all LightBDD tests. The interface describes the runner with no context - please browse "LightBDD.Framework.Scenarios.Contextual" namespace for contextual runners extension methods. The runner instance can be obtained by installing package from "LightBDD.Integration.*" group and deriving test class from FeatureFixture class offered by integration package. The "LightBDD.Framework.Scenarios.*" namespaces offers a set of extension methods to execute tests with this runner.

member.name: T:LightBDD.Framework.LabelAttribute
member.summary: Label attribute that can be applied on feature test class or scenario method. May be used to link feature/scenario with external tools by storing ticket number. Multiple labels per item are supported.

member.name: P:LightBDD.Framework.LabelAttribute.Label
member.summary: Specified label.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.LabelAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor allowing to associate label text.

member.name: T:LightBDD.Framework.MultiAssertAttribute
member.summary: Multi Assert Attribute allows to configure scenario and/or step method to always execute all sub-steps no matter what is their outcome and report any exceptions after all sub-steps are executed. If any sub-step execution finish with failed status, an will be thrown with exceptions of all failed sub-steps. If none sub-steps failed but there are some with ignored status, the exception of first ignored sub-step would be thrown in order to properly ignore test in underlying test framework. All exceptions that have occurred during sub-steps execution would be included in the LightBDD report.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.MultiAssertAttribute.ExecuteAsync(LightBDD.Core.Execution.IStep,System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Method allowing to decorate step invocation specified by .
member.param: Invocation that should be called in the method body.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.MultiAssertAttribute.ExecuteAsync(LightBDD.Core.Execution.IScenario,System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Method allowing to decorate scenario invocation specified by .
member.param: Invocation that should be called in the method body.

member.name: P:LightBDD.Framework.MultiAssertAttribute.Order
member.summary: Order in which extensions should be applied, where instances of lower values would be executed first. The default value for is -1.

member.name: T:LightBDD.Framework.NoContext
member.summary: Class used to indicate that IBddRunner will execute scenarios without any additional context.

member.name: T:LightBDD.Framework.Notification.ParallelProgressNotifierProvider
member.summary: Class providing implementations of and interfaces. The implementations are designed to provide notifications that would be still understandable when scenarios are executed in parallel. Each notification entry is prefixed with text showing total number of processed, failed and currently running scenarios as well as scenario number the message is notified for.

member.name: P:LightBDD.Framework.Notification.ParallelProgressNotifierProvider.Default
member.summary: Returns default instance of provider.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Notification.ParallelProgressNotifierProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. The class should not be instantiated directly, but rather property should be used to get provider instance.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Notification.ParallelProgressNotifierProvider.CreateFeatureProgressNotifier(System.Action{System.String}[])
member.summary: Creates instance which would call actions with formatted notifications. The created notifier does nothing with formatted notifications that is why should contain at least 1 action in order to get notifications working.
member.param: Actions that would be called with formatted notifications.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Notification.ParallelProgressNotifierProvider.CreateScenarioProgressNotifier(System.Action{System.String}[])
member.summary: Creates instance which would call actions with formatted notifications. The created notifier does nothing with formatted notifications that is why should contain at least 1 action in order to get notifications working.
member.param: Actions that would be called with formatted notifications.

member.name: T:LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.ReportFileWriter
member.summary: Summary file writer class allows to save feature results by using associated result formatter and output path.

member.name: P:LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.ReportFileWriter.Formatter
member.summary: Returns configured formatter.

member.name: P:LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.ReportFileWriter.OutputPath
member.summary: Returns configured output path.

member.name: P:LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.ReportFileWriter.FullOutputPath
member.summary: Returns output path resolved to a full path.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.ReportFileWriter.#ctor(LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.Formatters.IReportFormatter,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor allowing to create ReportFileWriter with associated result formatter and output path. Please note that full output path is being resolved at time when constructor is called, not when results are saved, so any relative paths will be resolved at the construction of this class.
member.param: Output path. If starts with ~, it would be resolved to AppContext.BaseDirectory. It can contain string.Format() like parameters of {name:format} syntax. This constructor uses default to format these parameters. See () for more details on available parameter types.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.ReportFileWriter.#ctor(LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.Formatters.IReportFormatter,System.String,LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.ReportPathFormatter)
member.summary: Constructor allowing to create ReportFileWriter with associated result formatter, output path and path formatter. Please note that full output path is being resolved at time when constructor is called, not when results are saved, so any relative paths will be resolved at the construction of this class.
member.param: Output path. If starts with ~, it would be resolved to AppContext.BaseDirectory. It can contain string.Format() like parameters of {name:format} syntax.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.ReportFileWriter.Save(LightBDD.Core.Results.IFeatureResult[])
member.summary: Saves formatted feature results to file specified in constructor. If output path refers to directory which does not exist, it will be created.

member.name: T:LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.ReportFormattablePath
member.summary: Report file formattable path.

member.name: P:LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.ReportFormattablePath.FormattablePath
member.summary: Returns formattable path specified in constructor.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.ReportFormattablePath.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Func{LightBDD.Core.Results.IFeatureResult[],System.Object}})
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Formattable path string with String.Format() syntax.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.ReportFormattablePath.Resolve(LightBDD.Core.Results.IFeatureResult[])
member.summary: Resolves path by applying all the formats and resolving to a full path.

member.name: T:LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.ReportPathFormatter
member.summary: Summary file path formatter allowing to specify formattable paths with parameters like current date/time or time when test were executed. Formatter accepts string.Format() like parameters of {name:format} syntax, where name is a parameter name while format is string.Format() parameter format string (it is always required).

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.ReportPathFormatter.CreateDefault
member.summary:
Creates default that supports following format parameters:
CurrentDateTimeUtc - equivalent to DateTime.UtcNow (DateTime type)
CurrentDateTime - equivalent to DateTime.Now (DateTime type)
TestDateTimeUtc - utc date/time when test execution started (DateTime type)
TestDateTime - local date/time when test execution started (DateTime type)

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.ReportPathFormatter.Add(System.String,System.Func{LightBDD.Core.Results.IFeatureResult[],System.Object})
member.summary: Adds new format parameter.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Reporting.ReportPathFormatter.ToFormattablePath(System.String)
member.summary: Converts to by: * parameterizing path with configured parameter functions, * replacing starting '~' character with value of AppContext.BaseDirectory, if present, * resolving to full path if path is relative.

member.name: T:LightBDD.Framework.ScenarioCategoryAttribute
member.summary:
Scenario category attribute that can be applied on scenario test method. May be used to associate scenarios with specific categories. It is possible to apply multiple ScenarioCategory attributes on given scenario.
If given implementation supports alternative category attributes, and both are applied on scenario method, all of them would be used.

member.name: P:LightBDD.Framework.ScenarioCategoryAttribute.Category
member.summary: Scenario category name.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.ScenarioCategoryAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor accepting category name.

member.name: T:LightBDD.Framework.Scenarios.Basic.BasicScenarioBuilderExtensions
member.summary: Extensions class allowing to use basic scenario syntax for defining LightBDD scenarios in fluent way.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Scenarios.Basic.BasicScenarioBuilderExtensions.AddSteps(LightBDD.Framework.Scenarios.IScenarioBuilder{LightBDD.Framework.NoContext},System.Action[])
member.summary:
Adds steps specified by parameter.
The steps would be executed in specified order.
If given step throws, other are not executed.
The step name is determined from corresponding action name.
Example usage:
builder.AddSteps( Given_the_user_is_about_to_login, Given_the_user_entered_valid_login, Given_the_user_entered_valid_password, When_the_user_clicks_login_button, Then_the_login_operation_should_be_successful, Then_a_welcome_message_containing_user_name_should_be_returned);
Expected step signature:
void Given_the_user_is_about_to_login() { /* ... */ }

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Scenarios.Basic.BasicScenarioBuilderExtensions.AddAsyncSteps(LightBDD.Framework.Scenarios.IScenarioBuilder{LightBDD.Framework.NoContext},System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task}[])
member.summary:
Adds steps specified by parameter.
The steps would be executed in specified order.
If given step throws, other are not executed.
The step name is determined from corresponding action name.
Example usage:
builder.AddAsyncSteps( Given_the_user_is_about_to_login, Given_the_user_entered_valid_login, Given_the_user_entered_valid_password, When_the_user_clicks_login_button, Then_the_login_operation_should_be_successful, Then_a_welcome_message_containing_user_name_should_be_returned);
Expected step signature:
async Task Given_the_user_is_about_to_login() { /* ... */ }

member.name: T:LightBDD.Framework.Scenarios.Basic.BasicScenarioExtensions
member.summary: Extensions class allowing to use basic scenario syntax for running LightBDD tests.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Scenarios.Basic.BasicScenarioExtensions.RunScenario(LightBDD.Framework.IBddRunner,System.Action[])
member.summary:
Runs test scenario by executing given steps in specified order.
If given step throws, other are not executed.
Scenario name is determined from the method name in which () method is called.
Scenario labels are determined from attributes applied on scenario method.
Step name is determined from corresponding action name.
Example usage:
[Scenario] [Label("Ticket-1")] public void Successful_login() { Runner.RunScenario( Given_the_user_is_about_to_login, Given_the_user_entered_valid_login, Given_the_user_entered_valid_password, When_the_user_clicks_login_button, Then_the_login_operation_should_be_successful, Then_a_welcome_message_containing_user_name_should_be_returned); }
Expected step signature:
void Given_the_user_is_about_to_login() { /* ... */ }
member.param: List of steps to execute in order.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Scenarios.Basic.BasicScenarioExtensions.RunScenarioAsync(LightBDD.Framework.IBddRunner,System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task}[])
member.param: List of steps to execute in order.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Scenarios.Basic.BasicScenarioExtensions.RunScenarioActionsAsync(LightBDD.Framework.IBddRunner,System.Action[])
member.param: List of steps to execute in order.

member.name: T:LightBDD.Framework.Scenarios.Extended.ExtendedScenarioBuilderExtensions
member.summary: Extensions class allowing to use extended scenario syntax for defining LightBDD scenarios in fluent way.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Scenarios.Extended.ExtendedScenarioBuilderExtensions.AddSteps``1(LightBDD.Framework.Scenarios.IScenarioBuilder{``0},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Action{``0}}[])
member.summary:
Adds steps specified by parameter.
The steps would be executed in specified order.
If given step throws, other are not executed.
Step name is determined from lambda parameter name reflecting action type keyword, corresponding action name and passed list of parameters to called method.
If scenario is executed with context, the context instance is provided with lambda parameter. Please note that rules for placing parameter values in step name are as follows, where first matching rule would be used:
it will replace first occurrence of variable name written in capital letters (void Price_is_AMOUNT_dollars(int amount) => Price is "27" dollars)
it will placed after first occurrence of variable name (void Product_is_in_stock(string product) => Product "desk" is in stock)
it will placed at the end of step name (void Product_is_in_stock(string productId) => Product is in stock [productId: "ABC123"])
Example usage for scenarios with no context:
builder.AddSteps( _ => Given_product_is_available_in_product_storage("wooden desk"), _ => When_customer_buys_product("wooden desk"), _ => Then_invoice_should_contain_product_with_price_of_AMOUNT_pounds("wooden desk", 62));
Expected step signature:
void Given_product_is_available_in_product_storage(string product) { /* ... */ }
Example usage for scenarios with context:
builder.WithContext<SpeditionContext>().AddSteps( _ => _.Given_there_is_an_active_customer_with_id("ABC-123"), _ => _.Given_the_customer_has_product_in_basket("wooden shelf"), _ => _.When_the_customer_payment_finalizes(), _ => _.Then_product_should_be_dispatched_to_the_customer("wooden shelf"));
Expected step signature:
class SpeditionContext { void Given_product_is_available_in_product_storage(string product) { /* ... */ } }

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.Scenarios.Extended.ExtendedScenarioBuilderExtensions.AddAsyncSteps``1(LightBDD.Framework.Scenarios.IScenarioBuilder{``0},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Threading.Tasks.Task}}[])
member.summary:
Adds steps specified by parameter.
The steps would be executed in specified order.
If given step throws, other are not executed.
Step name is determined from lambda parameter name reflecting action type keyword, corresponding action name and passed list of parameters to called method.
If scenario is executed with context, the context instance is provided with lambda parameter. Please note that rules for placing parameter values in step name are as follows, where first matching rule would be used:
it will replace first occurrence of variable name written in capital letters (void Price_is_AMOUNT_dollars(int amount) => Price is "27" dollars)
it will placed after first occurrence of variable name (void Product_is_in_stock(string product) => Product "desk" is in stock)
it will placed at the end of step name (void Product_is_in_stock(string productId) => Product is in stock [productId: "ABC123"])
Example usage for scenarios with no context:
builder.AddAsyncSteps( _ => Given_product_is_available_in_product_storage("wooden desk"), _ => When_customer_buys_product("wooden desk"), _ => Then_invoice_should_contain_product_with_price_of_AMOUNT_pounds("wooden desk", 62));
Expected step signature:
async Task Given_product_is_available_in_product_storage(string product) { /* ... */ }
Example usage for scenarios with context:
builder.WithContext<SpeditionContext>().AddAsyncSteps( _ => _.Given_there_is_an_active_customer_with_id("ABC-123"), _ => _.Given_the_customer_has_product_in_basket("wooden shelf"), _ => _.When_the_customer_payment_finalizes(), _ => _.Then_product_should_be_dispatched_to_the_customer("wooden shelf"));
Expected step signature:
class SpeditionContext { async Task Given_product_is_available_in_product_storage(string product) { /* ... */ } }

member.name: T:LightBDD.Framework.StepExecution
member.summary: Step execution class, allowing to control step execution from method executing step.

member.name: P:LightBDD.Framework.StepExecution.Current
member.summary: Returns current step execution instance. Reference by property enables LightBDD extension packages to add functionality to with extension methods.

member.name: M:LightBDD.Framework.StepExecution.Bypass(System.String)
member.summary:
Bypasses currently executed step and continues execution of current scenario, allowing to execute all remaining steps. The step code located after StepExecution.Current.Bypass() call would not be executed.
The status of bypassed step would be and the overall status of scenario would be , unless any further step is failed or ignored.
Scenarios with status are recognized as successful tests in underlying test framework.
The argument would be used as step , and it would be aggregated in overall scenario as well.
The () method could be used in situations when:
It is not possible to implement given step at the moment (no required API is implemented yet), but all other steps are precise enough to prove that scenario is successful, i.e. situation when scenario checks overall and detailed cost of product and one of price component cannot be retrieved.
Step implementation does not exists, but it is possible to simulate it, so further steps can be executed, i.e. end-to-end tests, where the middle component does not exist yet.
The required API is not exposed yet, but it is possible to implement a workaround like direct data insert to database.
member.exception: Bypass exception used to control scenario execution.
